@@ -1,1 +110,114 @@		Name:    "kubelet-start",
		Short:   "Writes kubelet settings and (re)starts the kubelet",
		Long:    "Writes a file with KubeletConfiguration and an environment file with node specific kubelet settings, and then (re)starts kubelet.",

		Run:     runKubeletStart,

comments.body:
it's a little weird that this function only prints errors and doesn't return any errors.

kubeadm doesn't really have a way to fail out of this phase. If `TryStartKubelet` fails to start the Kubelet, a message is printed but nothing is returned.

This is probably ok and an existing limitation, but we could bail out of executing the phases earlier if this function returned an error.
I agree, I'm opening an issue for changing this here and in the join workflow
what's the reason behind using the `kubeletStartData` interface instead of casting it to a `*initData`?

sorry, i was so tired last night that i might have missed this.

i'm pretty sure that ConfigFileAndDefaultsToInternalConfig wil end up calling this:
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/ed958b7d79ee7eee0d71952e71475fe667c77909/cmd/kubeadm/app/util/version.go#L62

which handles the look up from the internet. it tries it, but then it falls back to the client version in air-gapped cases.

SetKubernetesVersion() on the hand falls back to the client version directly:
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/7f23a743e8c23ac6489340bbb34fa6f1d392db9d/cmd/kubeadm/app/phases/upgrade/versiongetter.go#L74

i guess it's a question if we want to always first fall back to the client version for this phase?
IMO Let's gets this into beta-2 an then eventually iterate for the air gapped/offline cases

ok, sounds good.
i guess my point was that the call to `SetKubernetesVersion` might be redundant, but i haven't verified.

			kubeadmutil.CheckErr(err)
